attributes.action: Scrap the water surface charge levied on public houses.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Pubs in parts of the UK actually have to pay three water bills per year.

They get charged for water coming into their building via water meter.
They then get charged for that same water going out of their building but at a lesser rate calculated by the incoming water figure.
Then on top of that they get charged a surface water charge (RAIN WATER LANDING ON THEIR ROOF) This is ridiculous and why should pubs be the only business to have to pay such a ridiculous charge?

I propose that this charge be dropped completely.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
